title: penalty : Fans express outrage as USWNT legend Megan Rapinoe laughs after missing crucial World Cup penalty
body_text:
An Unexpected Reaction
During the penalty shoot-out against Sweden, Rapinoe took USA's fourth penalty to give her team a potential 4-2 lead. However, her shot soared high over the crossbar, dashing hopes for victory. As she jogged back to the halfway line, she was seen smirking and laughing, sparking confusion and outrage among fans.Fans Express Displeasure
USA soccer fans took to social media to express their disappointment and frustration with Rapinoe's reaction. Many believed that her laughter undermined the seriousness of the situation and questioned her commitment to the team and the game.
Rapinoe Speaks Up
Despite the backlash, Rapinoe shared her thoughts after the game. She acknowledged the devastating loss and expressed gratitude for the team's efforts. Reflecting on her legacy with the USWNT, Rapinoe emphasized the team's fight for social change and its impact on the world.
Divided Opinions Throughout the Tournament
The USWNT faced a divided fanbase during the World Cup in Australia and New Zealand, with some players refusing to sing the national anthem before their matches. This controversial stance added to the tension surrounding the team's performance.
Disappointing World Cup Campaign
The USWNT entered the tournament with high hopes of becoming the first team, in the men's or women's game, to win three consecutive World Cups. However, their performance fell short of expectations, resulting in a second-place finish in Group E and an early exit in the round of 16.
Rapinoe's Retirement
Megan Rapinoe had previously announced her retirement from football at the end of the current NWSL season, making the World Cup her final appearance for the USWNT.
FAQs
Why was Megan Rapinoe laughing?
When questioned about her reaction to missing the penalty, she responded, "It's just a cruel joke. I've never hit it over; when I miss, they get saved."
Who missed the USA penalty?
In the dramatic penalty shootout on Sunday, Megan Rapinoe, Sophia Smith, and Kelly O'Hara were unsuccessful with their kicks from the penalty spot. In a nail-biting match, Sweden emerged victorious with a 5-4 scoreline, knocking the United States out of the World Cup after a tense scoreless draw in both regulation and extra time.
